prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0104, 0.0] On the XY plane of the new coordinate system, create the following 2D sketch: Sketch on face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.5, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.75] - Line 3: [0.5, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] - Loop 2: - Line 1: [0.0625, 0.0625] to [0.4375, 0.0625] - Line 2: [0.4375, 0.0625] to [0.4375, 0.6875] - Line 3: [0.4375, 0.6875] to [0.0625, 0.6875] - Line 4: [0.0625, 0.6875] to [0.0625, 0.0625] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by applying the following 3D rotation and translation: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0104, 0.0] Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.0104 units to create the 3D model. The resulting shape has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.0104 units - Height: 0.5 units (0.75 units including the extrusion depth)</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole running through its center. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch should consist of one face (face\\_1) with the following loop and lines: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0007, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.0007, 0.0], End Point [0.0007, 0.0059] + Line 3: Start Point [0.0007, 0.0059], End Point [0.0, 0.0059] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0059], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0059. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation information from the coordinate system and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. Step 5: Extrude the 3D sketch Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by a depth of 0.75 units (the same as the Z value of the translation vector). This will create a rectangular prism with a height of 0.75 units. Step 6: Create the cylindrical hole To create the cylindrical hole running through the center of the prism, you'll need to create a new sketch on the top surface of the prism and draw a circle with a radius of 0.5 units (half the diameter specified in the final shape description). After creating the circle, you can extrude it through the entire height of the prism to create the hole. Part 1 Dimensions The dimensions of the rectangular prism are as follows: * Length: 0.0059 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.0059 units Please note that the hole running through the prism is not included in these dimensions. The overall length, width, and height of the final shape will be influenced by the size and location of the hole.</description>

For the first loop, create four lines as follows: 1. A horizontal line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.03, 0.0), 2. A vertical line from point (0.03, 0.0) to point (0.03, 0.03), 3. A horizontal line from point (0.03, 0.03) to point (0.0, 0.03), 4. A vertical line from point (0.0, 0.03) to point (0.0, 0.0). This loop forms a square of 0.03 x 0.03 units. For the second loop, create four lines as follows: 1. A line starting 0.0015 units away from the origin along both the X and Y axes, and ending at a point 0.0285 units away from the origin along the X-axis (0.0285, 0.0015), 2. A horizontal line from (0.0285, 0.0015) to point (0.0285, 0.0285), 3. A vertical line from (0.0285, 0.0285) to point (0.0015, 0.0285), 4. A horizontal line from (0.0015, 0.0285) back to the starting point (0.0015, 0.0015). This loop forms an inner square of 0.027 x 0.027 units, centered at a point 0.0015 units away from the origin, leaving a narrow 0.0015-unit wide edge along the X and Y axes. **Extrude the 2D Sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis (normal direction) by 0.1875 units and in the opposite direction of the normals by another 0.1875 units. This results in a final height of 0.375 units. Combine this height with the length of 2 units (0.03 units x 66.6667= 2 units) and the width of 1 unit (0.03 units x 33.3333 = 1 unit) to form the final rectangular prism shape. Apply a NewBodyFeatureOperation to finalize the part. The first part is complete. Continue with the following parts and repeat the process with the appropriate dimensions and shapes.</description>
